hero.description: Sokola helps parents design a personalized, high-quality learning journey for their child.

breakFree.title: Break Free from Outdated Schooling
breakFree.desc: 7 million young Indonesians believe the formal education system is broken. Sokola offers a real alternative.

affordable.title: Affordable, Flexible, and Personal
affordable.desc: Build a curriculum that fits your child's needs and your family's budget—no more overpriced private schools or ineffective public options.

aiGuidance.title: AI-Powered Guidance
aiGuidance.desc: Our AI suggests the best mix of local courses, online resources, and community activities, tailored to your child's interests and goals.

community.title: Unlock Community Potential
community.desc: Hire talented local instructors, connect with other parents, and tap into a growing network of learning opportunities.

trackProgress.title: Track Progress, Not Just Attendance
trackProgress.desc: Monitor your child's growth, skills, and experiences—not just grades.

testimonial1.quote: I never thought I could give my kids a better education than private school, but Sokola made it possible—and affordable.
testimonial1.author: Dwi, Parent

testimonial2.quote: Sokola's AI curriculum gave my son the confidence to pursue his interests and learn at his own pace.

featuresPreview.discover: Discover and enroll in local and online courses

q1.q: Is Sokola only for homeschooling families?
q1.a: No! Sokola is for any parent who wants more control and better options for their child's education—whether you supplement school or go fully independent.

q2.q: How does Sokola keep education affordable?
q2.a: By connecting you with local instructors, community activities, and a la carte courses, you only pay for what your child needs—no expensive tuition.

q3.q: What if I don't know how to plan a curriculum?
q3.a: Our AI and community resources guide you every step of the way, making it easy to build and adjust your child's learning plan.

decliningQuality.title: School Quality in Decline
decliningQuality.desc: Indonesia's PISA scores dropped to 70th globally—2.5 years behind Vietnam.

teacherShortage.title: Teacher Crisis
teacherShortage.desc: 81% of teachers fail to meet minimum competency standards.

globalGap.title: Widening Global Gap
globalGap.desc: Only 40% of rural students have reliable internet; urban-rural divide grows.

privateTrap.title: Private School Trap
privateTrap.desc: Private school costs up 560%—68% of families take on debt for education.

needInnovation.title: Parents Need New Solutions
needInnovation.desc: Digital learning and community action are the best hope for most families.
